intro: Salacia intermedia, commonly known as the Malabar spurge, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Asia. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its succulent leaves and striking yellow-orange flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and often have a waxy texture, while its flowers are clustered in complex inflorescences. Salacia intermedia is also valued for its medicinal properties in traditional medicine systems.
